column4: Anyone here run ubuntu with cedega for their games.. does it work ok?
Depends on the games
You could, but not on this channel.
i always pay for things that work nice and impress me.
Cedega has an interface that allows you to mount cd/dvd media, then run the installer.
All you need is the game's media. No windows.
ok thanks.
Check the cedega website for any issues that some games night have (they have a useful DB with info)
No, they'd be unusable slow.
heh if they run at all :P
After install, copy the data to where the app expects it, then run the game (Cedega will give it an icon, just double-click it)
thanks for that. ill note that for later.
It's the current - 1 stable
Ubuntu supports XFS, but you should stick to ext3 regardless.
No, that all works just fine.
ok. so why should I stick to ext3 over XFS which is used on commercial and military grade systems?
Because ext3 is far more mature and thus less like to mess up.
Well, I can only talk from experience in that respect, and ext3 never let me down, xfs has. Twice.
and it wasnt a hardware issue that caused it?
Nope, I still don't know what caused the second one, but the first one messed up ebcuase XFS's fsck tool trashed the fs after an unclean shutdown and deleted *everything*.
blood hell. thats rather sad.
Yes, luckily that was 2 days after install, so I didn't actually lsoe anything.
lucky then.
im thinking of creating an LVM, and might go with ext3 at this stage...
